name: Neovim Configuration Workspace
description: Comprehensive multi-platform Neovim configuration with modular plugin architecture
system_prompt: You are working with a sophisticated Neovim configuration that supports Windows, Linux (WSL2), and macOS. The configuration uses lazy.nvim for plugin management and is organized into modular feature categories. The codebase follows consistent patterns with OS-specific adaptations, centralized constants, and comprehensive language support including C#/.NET, Java, Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, LaTeX, and more.

groups.name: Core Configuration
groups.description: Entry point files and core Neovim settings that bootstrap the entire configuration
groups.system_prompt: Focus on the main entry points and core configuration files that set up Neovim options, commands, keymappings, and plugin loading. These are the foundation files that determine how the entire configuration loads and operates.

groups.name: LSP & Language Support
groups.description: Language Server Protocol configuration, formatters, linters, and language-specific settings
groups.system_prompt: Focus on LSP setup, language server configurations, formatting, linting, and language-specific features. This includes Mason for tool installation, Conform for formatting, nvim-lint for linting, and individual language server configurations.

groups.name: Text Editing & UI
groups.description: Text editing enhancements, user interface components, completion, and visual improvements
groups.system_prompt: Focus on text editing features, UI components, completion systems, and visual enhancements. This includes blink-cmp for completion, neotree for file exploration, lualine for status line, snacks picker, and various editing utilities.

groups.name: Git Integration
groups.description: Git-related functionality including gitsigns, neogit, diffview, and GitHub integration
groups.system_prompt: Focus on Git workflow tools and integration. This includes gitsigns for line-level git info, neogit for git UI, diffview for diffs, and octo.nvim for GitHub integration.

groups.name: Debug & Testing
groups.description: Debugging tools and testing frameworks including nvim-dap, neotest, and language-specific adapters
groups.system_prompt: Focus on debugging and testing infrastructure. This includes nvim-dap for debugging, neotest for unit testing, and language-specific adapters for Python, .NET, and JavaScript testing and debugging.

groups.name: Document Authoring
groups.description: Document creation and editing tools including VimTeX, Markdown, and note-taking systems
groups.system_prompt: Focus on document authoring capabilities including LaTeX with VimTeX, Markdown preview and rendering, and note-taking with zk. These tools support academic and technical writing workflows.

groups.name: AI & LLM Integration
groups.description: AI-powered coding assistance and LLM integration including CodeCompanion and related tools
groups.system_prompt: Focus on AI integration for coding assistance, chat capabilities, and LLM-powered development tools. This includes CodeCompanion for Claude AI integration, history management, and MCP hub integration.

groups.name: Utilities & Miscellaneous
groups.description: Utility plugins, theme configuration, notifications, and other miscellaneous functionality
groups.system_prompt: Focus on utility functions, UI enhancements, notifications, theme management, and various helper plugins that support the overall Neovim experience.
